result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Winton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven M Winton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven M Winton was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Steven M Winton was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Ct.1 - Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Ct.3 - Pay fine of $400.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Ct.3 - Spend 60 days in the county jail, commencing 7/2/16 @ 8am.  Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 2 days served.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 2 days served.

JOC is amended for conditional jail time (Court orders 120 days which includes the 60 days originally ordered)  COMMENCE FORTHWITH
***DEFT is NOT allowed huber or the Electronic Leg Monitor.  
***Credit for 61 days.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John German.  Clerk: PT
DE was not suppose to be released on an ELM as ordered at sentencing, which was not present on JOC so he was let out on ELM and violated his conditions.  Court orders 120 days conditional jail time in the KCJ forthwith, which includes the 60 days originally ordered.  Credit for 61 days.  DE is not allowed Huber or the Electronic Leg Monitor.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John German.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty entered on 3/4/16.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 3 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  Count 3 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  60 days in Co. Jail w/Huber (ELM not allowed) commencing 7/2/16 at 8:00 a.m.  Credit for 2 days served.  Fined $400 + costs, to be paid during term of probation.  Driving privileges revoked for 14 months.  Ignition interlock ordered.  Alcohol assessment ordered.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Steven M Winton, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State.  DE's prior plea of Guilty remains as to Count 1.  Counts 2 & 3 - Not Guilty pleas entered.  Atty German states they are still waiting for documentation from DOT in Kentucky before proceeding with a plea in Counts 2 & 3.  Parties request a new date for sentencing on Count 1.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from ADA Trigg
Amended

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Steven M Winton, appeared with Attorney John E. German. Clerk: PT.
Parties jointly request an adjournment.  ADA Trigg states she will be filing amended information to add an OWI 2nd and Atty German states he has no objection.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John German.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 5/4/16 at 11:00.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John German.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty German requests more time to complete his investigation.  FPT 3/4/16 at 10:00 (no further adjournments).  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John German.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. finished inpatient treatment on 1/19/16.  Atty German requests time to discuss settlement options with the State.  FPT 2/11/16 at 8:40.  Bond continued.

Def. is in an inpatient treatment program and is not available for court on 12/2/15 at 8:30.  At request of Atty German and with OK of ADA Trigg, pretrial rescheduled to 1/21/16 at 10:15.  Parties notified by email.

Defendant, Steven M Winton, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
